info.title: Notion API
info.description: Notion API 2025-09-03 - Data Source Edition. Breaking change: Database endpoints replaced with data source endpoints.

property.description: The name of the property to sort by

timestamp.description: Use this instead of 'property' to sort by timestamp

checkboxFilter.description: Filter conditions for checkbox property type

equals.description: Check if checkbox equals the specified value

does_not_equal.description: Check if checkbox does not equal the specified value

dateFilter.description: Filter conditions for date property type

equals.description: Check if date equals the specified ISO 8601 date

before.description: Check if date is before the specified ISO 8601 date

after.description: Check if date is after the specified ISO 8601 date

on_or_before.description: Check if date is on or before the specified ISO 8601 date

on_or_after.description: Check if date is on or after the specified ISO 8601 date

is_not_empty.description: Check if date is not empty

past_week.description: Check if date is within the past week

past_month.description: Check if date is within the past month

past_year.description: Check if date is within the past year

next_week.description: Check if date is within the next week

next_month.description: Check if date is within the next month

next_year.description: Check if date is within the next year

this_week.description: Check if date is within the current week

filesFilter.description: Filter conditions for files property type

is_empty.description: Check if files array is empty

is_not_empty.description: Check if files array is not empty

multiSelectFilter.description: Filter conditions for multi-select property type

contains.description: Check if multi-select contains the specified option

does_not_contain.description: Check if multi-select does not contain the specified option

is_not_empty.description: Check if multi-select is not empty

numberFilter.description: Filter conditions for number property type

equals.description: Check if number equals the specified value

does_not_equal.description: Check if number does not equal the specified value

greater_than.description: Check if number is greater than the specified value

less_than.description: Check if number is less than the specified value

greater_than_or_equal_to.description: Check if number is greater than or equal to the specified value

less_than_or_equal_to.description: Check if number is less than or equal to the specified value

is_not_empty.description: Check if number is not empty

peopleFilter.description: Filter conditions for people property type

contains.description: Check if people contains the specified user ID (UUIDv4)

does_not_contain.description: Check if people does not contain the specified user ID (UUIDv4)

is_empty.description: Check if people array is empty

is_not_empty.description: Check if people array is not empty

relationFilter.description: Filter conditions for relation property type

contains.description: Check if relation contains the specified page ID (UUIDv4)

does_not_contain.description: Check if relation does not contain the specified page ID (UUIDv4)

is_not_empty.description: Check if relation is not empty

richTextFilter.description: Filter conditions for rich text property type

equals.description: Check if text equals the specified value

does_not_equal.description: Check if text does not equal the specified value

contains.description: Check if text contains the specified value

does_not_contain.description: Check if text does not contain the specified value

starts_with.description: Check if text starts with the specified value

ends_with.description: Check if text ends with the specified value

is_not_empty.description: Check if text is not empty

selectFilter.description: Filter conditions for select property type

equals.description: Check if select equals the specified option

does_not_equal.description: Check if select does not equal the specified option

is_not_empty.description: Check if select is not empty

syncedBlockRequest.description: Reusable block that syncs content across all instances. Can be original (synced_from: null) with children, or duplicate (synced_from: {block_id}) without children.

oneOf.description: Original synced block that contains the source content
Duplicate synced block that references the original

block_id.description: The ID of the original synced block

children.description: Child blocks (only for original synced blocks where synced_from is null)

embedBlockRequest.description: Embed block for displaying external content from services like Figma, YouTube, Twitter, Google Maps, Miro, and more. The embed block displays a preview of the external website within the Notion UI.

embed.description: Embed object containing the URL to the external content

url.description: The URL of the website to embed. Supports services like Figma, YouTube, Twitter/X, Google Maps, Miro, PDF files, and other embeddable content.

breadcrumbBlockRequest.description: Breadcrumb navigation block showing page hierarchy path

equationBlockRequest.description: Mathematical formula block using KaTeX syntax. Example expressions: 'E = mc^2', '\frac{a}{b}', 'x^2 + y^2 = z^2', '\sum_{i=0}^{n} i^2'

expression.description: KaTeX-compatible mathematical expression. Examples: simple formulas like 'E = mc^2', complex notation like '\frac{a}{b}' or '\int_{0}^{\infty} x^{-1} dx'

children.description: Optional children inside the toggle (any block types)

childDatabaseBlockRequest.description: A child_database block represents an inline database within a page. This allows creating a database as a child of a page.

child_database.description: Child database object containing the database title

title.description: The plain text title of the database

childPageBlockRequest.description: A child_page block represents a page within a page. This allows creating a nested page structure.

child_page.description: Child page object containing the page title

title.description: The plain text title of the page

columnListBlockRequest.description: Container for multi-column layout, requires 2+ column children

columnBlockRequest.description: Individual column in a multi-column layout

column.description: Column object with optional width ratio

width_ratio.description: Width ratio between 0 and 1. Should sum to 1 across sibling columns. Defaults to equal widths when omitted.

children.description: Child content inside the column (any block types except column)

linkPreviewBlockRequest.description: Rich link preview card showing title, description, and image from URL

url.description: The URL to generate a link preview for

templateBlockRequest.description: Template button that duplicates its children when clicked

rich_text.description: Optional rich text array for the template button label

children.description: Template content to duplicate when the button is clicked

partialUser.description: A partial user object with minimal information, used in page objects for created_by and last_edited_by fields

dataSourceProperty.description: Schema definition for a single property in a data source

title.description: Configuration for title type properties (empty object if present)

rich_text.description: Configuration for rich text type properties (empty object if present)

date.description: Configuration for date type properties (empty object if present)

people.description: Configuration for people type properties (empty object if present)

files.description: Configuration for files type properties (empty object if present)

checkbox.description: Configuration for checkbox type properties (empty object if present)

url.description: Configuration for URL type properties (empty object if present)

email.description: Configuration for email type properties (empty object if present)

created_time.description: Configuration for created time type properties (empty object if present)

created_by.description: Configuration for created by type properties (empty object if present)

last_edited_time.description: Configuration for last edited time type properties (empty object if present)

last_edited_by.description: Configuration for last edited by type properties (empty object if present)

options.description: Array of available status options for the property

groups.description: Array of option groups for the property

option_ids.description: A sorted list of ids of all options that belong to a group

place.description: Configuration for place type properties (empty object if present)

unique_id.description: Configuration for unique ID type properties

prefix.description: A common prefix assigned to pages in the data source

phone_number.description: Configuration for phone number type properties (empty object if present)

dataSourceResponse.description: Response schema for data source retrieve/create/update operations

id.description: Unique identifier for the data source

properties.description: Schema definitions for all properties in this data source

pageObject.description: A page object representing a single page in a data source. Pages in data sources are data source rows.

created_time.description: ISO 8601 date-time string when the page was created

last_edited_time.description: ISO 8601 date-time string when the page was last edited

last_edited_by.description: User who last edited the page

oneOf.description: File object for the cover image

cover.description: Page cover image file object or null

icon.description: Page icon (emoji or file object) or null

archived.description: The archived status of the page

in_trash.description: Whether the page is in Trash

properties.description: Property values of this page. Keys are property names and values are property value objects. If parent.type is 'database_id' or 'data_source_id', keys and values are determined by the properties of the data source. Otherwise, the only valid key is 'title'

type.description: The type of the property value

url.description: The URL of the Notion page

public_url.description: The public page URL if the page has been published to the web, otherwise null

queryDataSourceResponse.description: Response schema for data source query operations

results.description: Array of page objects matching the query

next_cursor.description: Cursor for the next page of results. Null if there are no more results.

has_more.description: Whether there are more results available

type.description: Type of the results (always 'page' for data source queries)

tags.name: Databases
tags.description: Database endpoints for retrieving database metadata

tags.name: Data sources
tags.description: Data source endpoints for querying and managing databases

tags.name: Pages
tags.description: Page endpoints for creating and managing pages

tags.name: Blocks
tags.description: Block endpoints for managing page content

parameters.name: start_cursor
parameters.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

query.description: The text that the API compares page and database titles against.

sort.description: A set of criteria, `direction` and `timestamp` keys, that orders the results. The **only** supported timestamp value is `"last_edited_time"`. Supported `direction` values are `"ascending"` and `"descending"`. If `sort` is not provided, then the most recently edited results are returned first.

direction.description: The direction to sort. Possible values include `ascending` and `descending`.

timestamp.description: The name of the timestamp to sort against. Possible values include `last_edited_time`.

filter.description: A set of criteria, `value` and `property` keys, that limits the results to either only pages or only data sources. Possible `value` values are `"page"` or `"data_source"`. The only supported `property` value is `"object"`.

value.description: The value of the property to filter the results by.  Possible values for object type include `page` or `data_source`.  **Limitation**: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `data_source`)

property.description: The name of the property to filter by. Currently the only property you can filter by is the object type.  Possible values include `object`.   Limitation: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `data_source`)

start_cursor.description: A `cursor` value returned in a previous response that If supplied, limits the response to results starting after the `cursor`. If not supplied, then the first page of results is returned. Refer to [pagination](https://developers.notion.com/reference/intro#pagination) for more details.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list to include in the response. Maximum: `100`.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a [block](ref:block)

parameters.name: start_cursor
parameters.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a [block](ref:block). Also accepts a [page](ref:page) ID.

children.description: Child content to append to a container block as an array of [block objects](ref:block)

after.description: The ID of the existing block that the new block should be appended after.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion block

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion block

type.description: The [block object `type`](ref:block#block-object-keys) value with the properties to be updated. Currently only `text` (for supported block types) and `checked` (for `to_do` blocks) fields can be updated.

archived.description: Set to true to archive (delete) a block. Set to false to un-archive (restore) a block.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion block

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion page

parameters.name: filter_properties
parameters.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the page. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values. To retrieve multiple properties, specify each page property ID. For example: `?filter_properties=iAk8&filter_properties=b7dh`.

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the Notion page to be updated.

properties.description: The property values to update for the page. The keys are the names or IDs of the property and the values are property values. If a page property ID is not included, then it is not changed.

in_trash.description: Set to true to delete a block. Set to false to restore a block.

icon.description: A page icon for the page. Supported types are [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) or [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object).

cover.description: A cover image for the page. Only [external file objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) are supported.

properties.description: The property values for the new page. The keys are the names or IDs of the property and the values are property values.

children.description: The content to be rendered on the new page, represented as an array of [block objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/block).

icon.description: The icon of the new page. Either an [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object) or an [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object)..

cover.description: The cover image of the new page, represented as a [file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object).

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion page

parameters.name: property_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a page [property](https://developers.notion.com/reference/page#all-property-values)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: For paginated properties. The max number of property item objects on a page. The default size is 100

parameters.name: start_cursor
parameters.description: For paginated properties.

get.description: Retrieves a list of un-resolved [Comment objects](ref:comment-object) from a page or block.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion block or page

parameters.name: start_cursor
parameters.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

post.description: Creates a comment in a page or existing discussion thread.

parent.description: The page that contains the comment

post.description: Query a data source (database) using filters and sorts

parameters.name: data_source_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion data source (database)

parameters.name: filter_properties
parameters.description: A list of page property value IDs to limit the response

property.description: The name of the checkbox property to filter by
The name of the date property to filter by
The name of the files property to filter by
The name of the multi-select property to filter by
The name of the number property to filter by
The name of the people property to filter by
The name of the relation property to filter by
The name of the rich text property to filter by
The name of the select property to filter by

oneOf.description: Compound filter - all conditions must match (AND). Combines multiple filter conditions that must all be true. Each condition can be a single filter (checkbox, date, files, multi_select, number, people, relation, rich_text, select) or a nested compound filter (and/or). Supports nesting up to 2 levels deep.

and.description: Array of filter conditions. Each item must have either a 'property' field (for single filters) or an 'and'/'or' field (for nested compound filters).

items.description: A filter condition. Can be a single filter with 'property' and a filter type (checkbox, date, files, multi_select, number, people, relation, rich_text, select), or a compound filter with 'and' or 'or'.

oneOf.description: Compound filter - any condition can match (OR). Combines multiple filter conditions where at least one must be true. Each condition can be a single filter (checkbox, date, files, multi_select, number, people, relation, rich_text, select) or a nested compound filter (and/or). Supports nesting up to 2 levels deep.

or.description: Array of filter conditions. Each item must have either a 'property' field (for single filters) or an 'and'/'or' field (for nested compound filters).

items.description: A filter condition. Can be a single filter with 'property' and a filter type (checkbox, date, files, multi_select, number, people, relation, rich_text, select), or a compound filter with 'and' or 'or'.

filter.description: Filter conditions for querying the data source. Can be a single filter (specify property name and filter type: checkbox, date, files, multi_select, number, people, relation, rich_text, select) or a compound filter using 'and'/'or' to combine multiple conditions (supports nesting up to 2 levels deep).

get.description: Retrieve metadata and schema for a data source

parameters.name: data_source_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion data source

patch.description: Update properties of a data source

parameters.name: data_source_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion data source

get.summary: List templates in a data source
get.description: List available templates for a data source

parameters.name: data_source_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion data source

get.description: Retrieves a database object using the ID specified. Returns database metadata including the list of data source IDs contained in the database.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion database

post.description: Move a page to a different parent location

parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion page
